text: Preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C).  In the bowl, mix together the sugar and tapioca.  Add the berries, almond extract and nutmeg. Stir gently. On a lightly floured board, roll half of the pastry into a 12 inch (30.5 cm) wide round. Carefully place it into the bottom of the 9 inch (22.9 cm) pie pan. Fill the pan with the berry mixture.  Still using the floured board, roll the other half of the pie crust mixture into an 11 inch (27.9 cm) round.  Lay the pastry over the fruit. Fold the edges under and pinch the rim to crimp and seal the crust. Set the pie in the foil lined baking pan. This is to catch the juice that will boil over from the pie. Place in the oven on the lowest rack until the filling is bubbling in the center and the crust is well browned. This will take about 70 minutes or so. If the edge of the crust begins to get too dark, cover it with aluminum foil. Allow the pie to cool. If making it ahead of time, it can remain covered at room temperature for up to a day. Cut into wedges and serve.
